description: John Terry will make his last appearance at Stamford Bridge in a Chelsea shirt in Sunday’s Premier League game against Sunderland.
title: 'I was worried he would join Man Utd': the inside story of John Terry and Chelsea

author: FourFourTwo
description: Antonio Conte has backed Chelsea great John Terry to make the move into management.
title: Conte: Chelsea captain Terry can be a good manager

author: FourFourTwo
description: John Terry waves goodbye to fans at Stamford Bridge on Sunday as his Chelsea career nears its end.
title: Terry describes 'toughest few weeks' in final Chelsea programme notes

author: FourFourTwo
description: John Terry is in no rush to decide on his next club after an emotional last home game at Stamford Bridge for Chelsea.
title: Terry in no rush to decide future after Stamford Bridge farewell

author: FourFourTwo
description: John Terry has been compared to Paolo Maldini and Francesco Totti by Antonio Conte, and the Chelsea boss wants him to keep playing.
title: Conte backs Terry to play on

author: FourFourTwo
description: Chelsea's John Terry paid tribute to his ex-managers, the fans and club owner Roman Abramovich after his last home match at Stamford Bridge.
title: Departing Terry hails Abramovich as 'best owner in world football'

author: FourFourTwo
description: Premier League champions Chelsea ended their campaign with a 5-1 win over Sunderland as John Terry said farewell to Stamford Bridge.
title: Chelsea 5 Sunderland 1: Terry bids emotional farewell as champions cruise

author: FourFourTwo
description: The curtain on John Terry's Stamford Bridge career came down on Sunday and he made an emotional early exit in his final home appearance.
title: Terry receives guard of honour after 26 minutes as he bids emotional early exit

author: FourFourTwo
description: Sunderland agreed to kick the ball out of play to facilitate John Terry's 26th-minute Stamford Bridge send-off, David Moyes has said.
title: Sunderland agreed to Terry's 26th minute send-off, reveals Moyes

author: BBC Sport
description: Chelsea players, including outgoing club legend John Terry, celebrate on the Stamford Bridge pitch after beating Sunderland 5-1 and lifting the Premier League trophy.
title: Chelsea celebrate after lifting Premier League trophy
